How about Thunderbird?
Because they are _mail_ apps.
There are many reasons why someone would not want a web-based mail.
1) Poor internet connection. 2) Privacy. 3) Security. 4) Easier management of multiple accounts. 5) To annoy people like you.
Not everyone uses Gmail.
HTTPS only protects one connection - between your computer and the Google server. The rest is unencrypted. And about multiple accounts - you _just_ asked how to manage two at the same time.
